title: What is the corporate culture? - Quora

response.answer_text: To me corporate culture is to have the freedom to work in your own way, in your own style. At the end, it’s the outcome which matters. In addition to it, one needs to have the freedom to expression him/herself and also the ideas one possess. In my current organization GreyB Services Pte. Ltd. we get all the freedom to share our ideas & thought and implemente them also.Culture is defined by the people following it. If the people are free in their mind &thought they can be lot more efficient in whatever they do. No matter how difficult or complicated a task is , it just becomes a cake walk when working in a free culture. Though free culture doesn’t mean that you can do whatever you feel like, it should be discussed and properly channelized to get the best of everything possible.It’s totally on the people who makes the culture whether home or in a office, all required is to make it worth and enjoyable.

Organizational culture is defined as the underlying beliefs, assumptions, values and ways of interacting that contribute to the unique social and psychological environment of an organization. Company culture is the personality of a company. It defines the environment in which employees work. Company culture includes a variety of elements, including work environment, company mission, value, ethics, expectations, and goals. The feeling of unity is one reason why creating a company culture is an important aspect of your business. Unity positively impacts the company by solidifying values and goals among employees, and also increases company morale. It embodies the core values of your company that each team member emulates.
